result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquis D Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Continue education.  Attend class every scheduled day without truancies.  Complete course work promply and cause no disruptions.  If in school part-time, obtain full-time, verifiable employment.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Participate in cognitive intervention, anger management and other counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Fully comply with rules of household set by mother.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  No association with persons known to possess, use or sell controlled substances.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.

**CORRECTED 9/7/2018: To reflect credit for time served as 466 days.**

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the Dirty P gang or any gang members.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including Anger Management and Cognitive Intervention. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: AMENDED 07-18-2016:  Length of ES amended from 4 years to 3 years as allowed per statute.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
